pages.text: There is clay indicator in the world telling you there is clay underneath it. $(br)It use wood logs as fuel. $(br)To create a firepit, you need 3 wooden sticks, a log and a fire starter. $(br)Put the 3 sticks and the log on a block and right click with the firestarter to create it. It may not work on the first try.

Clay is found by digging Clay Soil that spawns under one of six indicator Plants depending on the Climate of the region. $(br)Some Plants change what they look like depending on the season! $(br)Clay also requires a Rainfall value of 100 or greater and Dirt to spawn. $(br)Each deposit ranges from 4-14 blocks wide and 1-3 deep and each block can yield 1-3 clay balls. $(br)Clay can be mined by hand, but mining with a shovel vastly increases the speed.

Since the player spawns in a temperate region, Athyrium Ferns are the most common marker for early game clay deposits. $(br)$(br)Clay blocks can be crafted from clay balls, but they aren't the same as clay dirt. $(br)$(br)Clay blocks do not obey gravity, while clay dirt will fall if unsupported!
